verses.kjv: At that time the LORD said unto me, Hew thee two tables of stone like unto the first, and come up unto me into the mount, and make thee an ark of wood.
verses.ct: At that time the LORD told me, 'Cut 2 stone tablets just like the originals, then come up to me on the mountain. Also build a wooden chest.

verses.kjv: And I will write on the tables the words that were in the first tables which thou brakest, and thou shalt put them in the ark.
verses.ct: 'I will inscribe on the tablets the same words that were on the first tablets — the ones you shattered — and you will place them in the chest.'

verses.kjv: And I made an ark of shittim wood, and hewed two tables of stone like unto the first, and went up into the mount, having the two tables in mine hand.
verses.ct: So I constructed a chest out of acacia wood, cut 2 stone tablets identical to the first ones, and climbed up the mountain carrying the 2 tablets.

verses.kjv: And he wrote on the tables, according to the first writing, the ten commandments, which the LORD spake unto you in the mount out of the midst of the fire in the day of the assembly: and the LORD gave them unto me.
verses.ct: The LORD inscribed on the tablets the same thing as before — the 10 commandments that the LORD had spoken to you from the fire on the mountain during the day of the assembly. Then the LORD handed them over to me.

verses.kjv: And I turned myself and came down from the mount, and put the tables in the ark which I had made; and there they be, as the LORD commanded me.
verses.ct: I turned around and came back down the mountain, then placed the tablets inside the chest I had constructed. They remain there, just as the LORD instructed me.

verses.kjv: And the children of Israel took their journey from Beeroth of the children of Jaakan to Mosera: there Aaron died, and there he was buried; and Eleazar his son ministered in the priest’s office in his stead.
verses.ct: The Israelites traveled from Beeroth of the children of Jaakan to Mosera. That is where Aaron died and was buried, and his son Eleazar took over serving as priest in his place.

verses.kjv: From thence they journeyed unto Gudgodah; and from Gudgodah to Jotbath, a land of rivers of waters.
verses.ct: From there they traveled to Gudgodah, and from Gudgodah to Jotbath, a region with flowing streams.

verses.kjv: At that time the LORD separated the tribe of Levi, to bear the ark of the covenant of the LORD, to stand before the LORD to minister unto him, and to bless in his name, unto this day.
verses.ct: At that time the LORD set apart the tribe of Levi to carry the ark of the covenant of the LORD, to stand in the LORD's presence and serve him, and to pronounce blessings in his name — as they still do today.

verses.kjv: Wherefore Levi hath no part nor inheritance with his brethren; the LORD is his inheritance, according as the LORD thy God promised him.
verses.ct: That is why Levi received no share or inheritance among their brothers. The LORD himself is their inheritance, just as the LORD your God promised them.

verses.kjv: And I stayed in the mount, according to the first time, forty days and forty nights; and the LORD hearkened unto me at that time also, and the LORD would not destroy thee.
verses.ct: I remained on the mountain for 40 days and 40 nights, just like the first time. The LORD listened to me on this occasion as well, and the LORD chose not to destroy you.

verses.kjv: And the LORD said unto me, Arise, take thy journey before the people, that they may go in and possess the land, which I sware unto their fathers to give unto them.
verses.ct: Then the LORD told me, 'Get up and lead the people on their journey, so they can enter and take possession of the land that I swore to their ancestors I would give them.'

verses.kjv: And now, Israel, what doth the LORD thy God require of thee, but to fear the LORD thy God, to walk in all his ways, and to love him, and to serve the LORD thy God with all thy heart and with all thy soul,
verses.ct: So now, Israel, what does the LORD your God ask of you? Simply this: to be wholeheartedly dedicated to the LORD your God, to follow all his ways, to love him, and to serve the LORD your God with every part of your heart and soul,

verses.kjv: To keep the commandments of the LORD, and his statutes, which I command thee this day for thy good?
verses.ct: and to obey the LORD's commands and regulations that I am giving you today for your own benefit.

verses.kjv: Behold, the heaven and the heaven of heavens is the LORD’s thy God, the earth also, with all that therein is.
verses.ct: Look — the heavens, even the highest heavens, belong to the LORD your God, along with the earth and everything in it.

verses.kjv: Only the LORD had a delight in thy fathers to love them, and he chose their seed after them, even you above all people, as it is this day.
verses.ct: Yet the LORD was drawn to your ancestors and loved them, and he chose their descendants after them — that means you — out of all the peoples on earth, as is clear today.

verses.kjv: Circumcise therefore the foreskin of your heart, and be no more stiffnecked.
verses.ct: So dedicate your hearts to God and stop being so stubborn.

verses.kjv: For the LORD your God is God of gods, and Lord of lords, a great God, a mighty, and a terrible, which regardeth not persons, nor taketh reward:
verses.ct: Because the LORD your God is the God above all gods and the Lord above all lords — the great, powerful, and awe-inspiring God who shows no favoritism and accepts no bribes.

verses.kjv: He doth execute the judgment of the fatherless and widow, and loveth the stranger, in giving him food and raiment.
verses.ct: He ensures justice for orphans and widows, and he loves the foreigner by providing them with food and clothing.

verses.kjv: Love ye therefore the stranger: for ye were strangers in the land of Egypt.
verses.ct: So you must also love the foreigner, because you yourselves were foreigners in the land of Egypt.

verses.kjv: Thou shalt fear the LORD thy God; him shalt thou serve, and to him shalt thou cleave, and swear by his name.
verses.ct: You must be wholeheartedly dedicated to the LORD your God. Serve him, hold tightly to him, and take your oaths in his name.

verses.kjv: He is thy praise, and he is thy God, that hath done for thee these great and terrible things, which thine eyes have seen.
verses.ct: He is the one you praise, and he is your God — the one who performed these great and awe-inspiring things that you witnessed with your own eyes.

verses.kjv: Thy fathers went down into Egypt with threescore and ten persons; and now the LORD thy God hath made thee as the stars of heaven for multitude.
verses.ct: Your ancestors went down to Egypt as just 70 people, but now the LORD your God has made you as numerous as the stars in the heavens.
